questions.text: A 25-year-old female patient had to undergo a cesarean section in an institution due to a complicated delivery. She was discharged on her 5th-day postpartum. How many visits by an ASHA worker is recommended in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

As this case is an institutional delivery through LSCS, the patient would be discharged after 5-6 days from the hospital, therefore 5 visits by the ASHA worker are recommended here.

questions.text: A study was done to assess nutritional status among young children in rural and urban areas. 30 children in rural and 20 children in urban areas were malnourished. Which of the following tests of significance is the most appropriate in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Chi Square test

The most appropriate test of significance, in this case, is the chi-square test. It is used to compare qualitative data between 2 groups with independent measures.

questions.text: A 6-yr-old boy is brought to the clinical psychologist for evaluation of intellectual disability. Which formula will she use to calculate the IQ of the child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mental age x 100 / Chronological age

The intelligence quotient is a score that is obtained from several standardized tests to assess human intelligence.
Intelligence quotient (IQ) = Mental age x 100 / Chronological age

choices.text: No change in mean, decreased median
Decreased mean, no change in median

questions.text: While reviewing a data distribution, you find that the highest value of 58 was wrongly recorded as 85 and so you correct it. How will this correction change the measures of central tendency?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Decreased mean, no change in median

The given change in a dataset would cause a decrease in the mean but the median would remain unchanged. The mean is sensitive to every value in the distribution. Since the correct value of 58 is much lesser than the wrongly recorded value of 85, the final mean will be decreased compared to the earlier recorded value.

choices.text: Incision and application of INH powder
Incision and application of PAS powder

questions.text: A child who had recently received the BCG vaccine comes to you with complaints of fever, pain and swelling at the injection site. You suspect a localised abscess formation. Which of the following steps should be avoided in the treatment of this child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Systemic INH therapy

There is no need for systemic treatment with INH in case of a local abscess formation after BCG vaccination. If there is a local abscess formation following BCG vaccination, it should be treated by aspiration. If it does not clear, then it should be incised and INH or PAS powder should be applied daily to the site. The patient should be assured of the harmless nature of the lesion.

questions.text: An epidemiologist has determined five independent factors influencing the outcome of a particular disease. Which of the following statistical methods can he use to compare these factors?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Logistic regression

In this scenario, the outcome to be determined (dependent variable) is the occurrence of the disease, which is categorical (qualitative) in nature. Logistic regression can be used when a categorical dependent variable is being compared with either a categorical or numerical independent variable.

questions.text: A person wants to study about the relationship between smoking and lung cancer, so he collects data about people diseased with lung cancer from government hospitals and the number of cigarette packets sold at the same time period. Which type of study is this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ecological

The type of study described is an ecological study as the unit of study is the population. The number of cigarette packets sold at the same time is data about the population.

questions.text: A 27-year-old female comes to the STI clinic with minimal vaginal discharge. On speculum examination, erosions are seen on the cervix. Which of the following kit should be given to this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gray

This patient with vaginal discharge and erosions on the cervix has cervicitis from a sexually transmitted infection. She should be given the gray kit which contains cefixime and azithromycin.

questions.text: Workers are exposed to fine dust particles during the handling and processing of raw materials. You are concerned about which particle size range would pose the greatest health risk through inhalation. Which particle size of dust inhaled would be most concerning for worker health in this setting?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

0.5 to 3 microns

Particles in the size range of 0.5 to 3 microns are considered the most dangerous because they can penetrate deep into the lungs and are associated with various occupational lung diseases known as pneumoconioses.

choices.text: OPV booster, DPT booster, JE vaccine and Vitamin A
OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, and Vitamin A
OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A
OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, and JE.

questions.text: A farmer brought his 16-month-old child to the OPD for routine immunization. The child has been adequately immunised. He has already received measles vaccine during a supplementary immunisation activity a few months back. What vaccines can be administered now?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A 

Vaccines to be given at 16months of age: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, Vitamin A, and JE.  According to the schedule irrespective of the measles supplementary immunization activity dose, the child should receive the routine doses of the measles vaccine according to the schedule. So, the second dose of the measles vaccine is also given.

questions.text: A study was done to assess the malnutrition among young children. 100 children were selected each from rural and urban areas. Out of these, 30 among rural and 20 among urban were found to be malnourished. Which of the following statistical test is used to compare the data sets?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Chi square

The chi-square distribution, like the t distribution, is actually a series of distributions, the exact shape of which varies according to their degrees of freedom. Unlike the t distribution, however, the chi-square distribution is asymmetrical, positively skewed and never approaches normality.

questions.text: An investigator in a community hospital decides to examine all patients for a problem with alcoholism to determine prevalence in the community. In addition to recall bias, which of the following is the most obvious error in selecting all patients admitted to a community hospital?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Selection bias

Bias is a systematic error that may be introduced, generally unwittingly, into an investigation. Selection bias is due to systemic differences between those selected and not selected for a study. When selecting all admissions to a community hospital, alcoholics may be overrepresented among hospital patients and not reflect the community base from which the patients were admitted. Further, the investigator has not chosen a control sample but only patients already in the hospital, which further invalidates any outcome. While other biases may creep into this study, the selection bias is the major problem with the study.

questions.text: A new screening test for prostate cancer becomes available. You assess whether this will be useful to your practice by reviewing the operating characteristics of the test. The test’s ability to correctly classify diseased persons as having disease is called what?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sensitivity 

By definition, sensitivity is the probability of testing positive if the disease is truly present. It indicates the percentage of persons with the disease of interest who have positive test results. Positive predictive value estimates the probability of disease in those who have positive test results. It indicates the percentage of persons with positive test results who actually have the disease of interest.

questions.text: A public health physician wants to study the load of hypertension in community to design a health program for prevention of hypertension. Which is the most useful design for this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

Cross sectional 

To estimate the load of disease, we need to find the prevalence, which is given by the cross-sectional studies

questions.text: A resident doctor sustained a needlestick injury while sampling blood of a patient who is HIV positive. A decision is taken to offer him post-exposure prophylaxis. Which one of the following would be the best recommendation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Triple therapy with tenofovir 300mg, lamivudine 300mg, and dolutegravir 50mg for 4 weeks is recommended for HIV post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP).

choices.text: Urgent referral to the tertiary care centre immediately
Administer IV antibiotics and ask the patient to be brought after 24 hours

questions.text: A 24-month-old child weighing 11 kg was brought to the pediatric OPD. He had a respiratory rate of 38/min. On examination, chest indrawing was observed. What is the next step of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

From the given clinical picture, it appears that the child has pneumonia as diagnosed from the presence of chest indrawing. The next best step of management is to give oral amoxicillin for five days and send the child home.

questions.text: A patient comes with a history of clean-cut injury which is not lacerated. He says that he received his last dose of tetanus vaccination about 10 years ago. What should be given next?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

A single dose of tetanus toxoid is given as the wound is clean and the last dose was received more than 10 years ago.

questions.text: In a developing country, a team of public health researchers is conducting a study to assess the demographic trends and transitions within the population. They have collected data over several decades and have observed various stages of the demographic transition model. One of the key parameters they are analyzing is the demographic gap, which represents the difference between the birth rate and the death rate within a population. In which stage is this gap negative?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Stage 5

Stage 5 of the demographic transition model represents an advanced stage characterized by both low birth rates and low death rates. In this stage, the demographic gap becomes negative, meaning that the death rate exceeds the birth rate. This decline is often driven by factors such as an aging population, declining fertility rates, and potentially emigration. As a result, populations may experience negative growth or overall decline, which is why this stage is commonly referred to as the “declining phase.”

questions.text: A household consisting of a 35-year-old man, his pregnant wife and a child. The man's brother along with his wife is currently visiting them for a month owing to winter vacation. What type of family would the surveyor classify the household?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Nuclear family 

Based on the information, the household is classified as a nuclear family, comprising a married couple and their child. The brief visit of the husband's brother and his wife does not alter this classification, as no other family members live with them permanently.

questions.text: A school has a small outbreak were children are showing symptoms like runny nose, cough, fever and skin rash. The doctors identified it as measles outbreak. Which of the following is the correct time to give post exposure measles vaccine?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

In the case of a measles outbreak, post-exposure vaccination is recommended within 72 hours (3 days) of exposure to the virus. Administering the measles vaccine within this timeframe can help prevent or reduce the severity of the disease in susceptible individuals.
